column4: to me i wanted to install a program with apt-get (add/remove in programs) but i freezed
can you pastebin the output until it froze?
well i went to Programs and then add-remove and it suddenly freezed
well it has all the programs like apt-get right ?;D
the backend is still APT (the Debian/Ubuntu package manager), but APT is a different thing from apt-get
have you tried just clicking on the Close button of the window and waiting a while?
then hit Alt+F2 and type "xkill". you'll see a crosshair instead of the normal mouse button. click inside that winow.
i meant, instead of the normal mouse *cursor*
first thing is, try from a live CD « sudo mount /dev/whatever /some/temporary/directory » where /dev/whatever is the Windows partition
